I'm 15 and just started cycling at Christmas. My dad has brought me on a crash course on this particular topic and I bit it quite a few times. As ayhsmb has already mentioned, loosen the springs, when you feel confident tighten them a little bit more until you feel confident and repeat. It can be tricky at the start but it will become second nature, try to clip out a bit before you have to stop if your not confident, that helped me. I know I'm a little late posting to this thread but best of luck.

I had it for two years and have just gotten rid of it. Main Pros: 1. Compact 2. Lightweight 3. Good quality sound 4. Very easy set-up (get started in minutes) Main Cons: 1. Very beginner kit 2. Not to many sounds, cant add more 3. Not very much maneuverability with the toms and such. 4. Unable to add extra cymbals, toms etc. **TL;DR**: *Great for a beginner, or small apartment with the ability to hook it up to an amp or alternatively use it with headphones. Not so great for someone who has been playing for a while and wants the feel of a real Acoustic kit in front of you.*

WRITING.TITLE: [Build Ready] About ready to pull the trigger. Need some advice going into my first build. Rig will be mostly for gaming.
WRITING.TEXT: [PCPartPicker part list](http://pcpartpicker.com/p/cBej) / [Price breakdown by merchant](http://pcpartpicker.com/p/cBej/by_merchant/) / [Benchmarks](http://pcpartpicker.com/p/cBej/benchmarks/) Type|Item|Price :----|:----|:---- **CPU** | [Intel Core i5-3450 3.1GHz Quad-Core Processor](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/intel-cpu-bx80637i53450) | $149.99 @ Microcenter **Motherboard** | [ASRock Z68 PRO3 GEN3 ATX LGA1155 Motherboard](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/asrock-motherboard-z68pro3gen3) | $104.99 @ Newegg **Memory** | [Corsair Vengeance 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR3-1600 Memory](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-memory-cml8gx3m2a1600c9) | $52.99 @ NCIX US **Hard Drive** | [Seagate Barracuda 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/seagate-internal-hard-drive-st310005n1a1asrk) | $94.99 @ Newegg **Video Card** | [Gigabyte GeForce GTX 670 2GB Video Card](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/gigabyte-video-card-gvn670oc2gd) | $399.99 @ Newegg **Case** | [Zalman Z11 Plus ATX Mid Tower Case](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/zalman-case-z11plus) | $52.99 @ Microcenter **Power Supply** | [OCZ 550W ATX12V Power Supply](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/ocz-power-supply-oczzt550w) | $49.99 @ NCIX US **Optical Drive** | [LG GH22NS90B DVD/CD Writer](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/lg-optical-drive-gh22ns90b) | $19.98 @ Outlet PC | | **Total** | Prices include shipping and discounts when available. | $925.91 | Generated by PCPartPicker 2012-07-20 06:36 EDT-0400 | I'm wondering if there's anything I can lose (or add) in the build. My bugdet is around 1000e but parts are crazy expensive over here (Eire) and almost 1:1 dollars to euro.The exact same parts are costing me 973e -_- I have a monitor, mouse and keyboard. And a spare key for win7 Ultimate a friend gave me! Yay! Thanks again. PS:Deleted forst post seconds after publishing because i forgot to tag it as build ready, so sorry about that. I think the problem here is not that they're making the game more technical and challenging, but that they're making the one gamemode that was a "Just for Fun" mode into one of the the other two more serious sim type gamemodes. I prefer to hop on after a long day, twist and turn, do mad shit and just have FUN. 1.29 has destroyed this. Why would you choose to play arcade now? After all, FRB and HB give more xp and lions. It's ruined a whole gamemode that for many people was the most enjoyable thing about the game.

My In-Ears keep getting suddenly and permanently quiet in one ear followed by the other. I keep good care of 'em most of the time. It's happened to 2 pairs in a row now - one pair of sennheiser 5.00 and another pair of 10 buck generic-o's. Only really use them with my Galaxy S7 Edge which I dont believe has any known issues with drivers? Afraid to buy another pair in case it is the phone and they break again straight away. I dont think my poor student budget is capable of that kind of disposable income. Any help or insight would be much appreciated!

Yeah I was aware of this from a few other threads I read while lurking here. The funny thing is both sets had L-Jacks. Maybe I just need to be more careful. What I'm really wondering is if it could be my phone I suppose - or if there's any way to test that theory apart from the not-so-scientific method of wrecking another pair of headphones. Cheers anyway!

gt;It's just a token gesture rather than they actually thought he was right for the role and someone who doesn't have down syndrome who worked really hard to try and get a job in this line of work missed out just by virtue of not having this condition which I think is kind of shitty. And why can't it be the case that this man worked hard to be chosen for this job as well? He shows off the clothes just as well as a model without down syndrome would, while also serving as inspiration for other young men and women with down syndrome. I can't believe you're claiming he doesn't deserve it just because a "normal" model might have missed out on a job. That's ludicrous.
Toto is like the one kid who always moaned about how they were going to fail the exam, and then came top of the class. No one liked that kid, Toto.

I disagree. There are hundreds of examples of athletes involved in doping - particularly blood doping - suffering tragic premature deaths due to exactly this type of thing (MI, stroke, DVT etc). I'd hate to cast aspersions on such a well respected player - especially in a time where they're clearly in need of support and have just had a scare like this - but the conversation is worth having. If for no other reason than to raise awareness of the dangers and attempt to dissuade young athletes from doing it.

Essentially, Ireland is constitutionally committed to the pacific settlement of international disputes. Getting a seat on the UNSC puts us in a position where, maybe naively, some believe we may be able to lobby some of the... less pacific members towards more humane conflict resolution. If you believe in the UN, getting a seat on the UNSC is a pretty big nod from the international community.
Yep. See [Article 29](http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/eli/cons/en#part7) on International Relations

Well the alternative is having your fate decided entirely by a member of a select, realtively homogenous group of white, upper-class, (usually) FF/FG-affiliated judges. Grand if you're also a white, middle/upper class person; not so grand if you're not. Jury trials are vital to a fair and impartial justice system.

Any one of them? No, not necessarily. But that's why theres 12 of them. Not to presume your knowledge of the judiciary, but I think you might be surprised at the open bias demonstrated by some of its members in this country. Judges determine questions of law, 12 of your peers determine questions of fact. It's the best way we've found to eliminate bias from the system.
Germany has an entirely different legal system. Their system also has several problems due to that very fact.

Three I believe. It adds a decent amount of impartiality and cancels out some of the stuff I mentioned. At the end of the day, the special criminal court exists to prosecute some very dangerous individuals and so is set up in the way it is to avoid jury tampering, intimidation, etc. I have some issues with it, but all in all I can forgive them for the task it carries out. I just think that eliminating jury trials altogether in all our courts is definitely a step too far.
